data.title: Browse recent arrivals in National Film Registry from Royal Books, Inc.
data.meta_description: How Green Was My Valley (Four original photographs from the 1941 film). Los Angeles: Twentieth Century-Fox, 1941.  Four vintage studio still photographs from the French release of …
data.text:
More Photos

How Green Was My Valley (Four original photographs from the 1941 film)

by John Ford (director); Philip Dunne (screenwriter); Richard Llewellyn (novel); Walter Pidgeon, Maureen O'Hara, Donald Crisp, Sara Allgood (starring)

Show Details

Description:

Los Angeles: Twentieth Century-Fox, 1941. Four vintage studio still photographs from the French release of the 1941 film. French Twentieth Century-Fox stamps on the versos, and one with cropping annotations in manuscript pencil. Based on Richard Llewellyn's 1939 novel. The men of the Morgan family earn a living working in their small Welsh town's mine, where they face… Read more about this item

Item Price

US$325.00

More Photos

Rebel Without a Cause (Original photograph of James Dean on the set of the 1955 film)

by James Dean (starring); Nicholas Ray (director); Robert Lindner (book); Stewart Stern, Irving Shulman (screenwriters); Natalie Wood, Dennis Hopper, Sal Mineo (starring)

Show Details

Description:

N.p.: N.p., 1955. Vintage reference photograph from the 1955 film, showing James Dean with other cast and crew members on the set. Paris dealer stamp on the verso. Nicholas Ray's searing study of juvenile delinquency, generational divide, and moral decay in suburban America, loosely based on Robert Lindner's 1944 book "Rebel Without a Cause: The Hypnoanalysis of a… Read more about this item

Item Price

US$450.00

More Photos

The Best Years of Our Lives (Original production document for the 1946 film)

by William Wyler (director); MacKinlay Kantor (novella); Robert E. Sherwood (screenwriter); Myrna Loy, Fredric March, Dana Andrews (starring)

Show Details

Description:

Culver City, CA: RKO Radio Pictures, 1946. Draft production document made for the shooting of the 1946 film, entirely specific to the many extras in the film (see images). Lacking the front wrapper and the first 4 leaves of text. Based on MacKinlay Kantor's 1945 classic novella "Glory for Me," about three veterans who return home, only to… Read more about this item

Item Price

US$225.00

More Photos

Paths of Glory (Collection of 12 original photographs from the 1957 film)

by Stanley Kubrick (director, screenwriter); Jim Thompson (screenwriter); Humphrey Cobb (novel); Kirk Douglas, Ralph Meeker (starring)

Show Details

Description:

Beverly Hills, CA: United Artists, 1957. Collection of 12 vintage photographs from the 1957 film, including one reference photograph and eleven studio still photographs. One of the great antiwar films, based on the 1935 novel by Humphrey Cobb, about a group of French soldiers who are charged with cowardice after refusing to complete a suicidal attack during… Read more about this item

Item Price

US$750.00

More Photos

How Green Was My Valley (Original screenplay for the 1941 film)

by Maureen O'Hara, Walter Pidgeon, Donald Crisp (starring); John Ford (director); Philip Dunne (screenwriter); Richard Llewellyn (novel)

Show Details

Description:

Los Angeles: Twentieth Century-Fox, 1941. Second Revised Final script for the 1941 film. Based on Richard Llewellyn's 1939 novel. The men of the Morgan family earn a living working in their small Welsh town's mine, where they face dangerous and unhealthy conditions, and exploitation at the hands of the mine owners. Winner of five Academy Awards, including… Read more about this item

Item Price

US$2,750.00

More Photos

It's a Wonderful Life (Original double weight photograph from the 1946 film)

by James Stewart, Donna Reed, Gloria Grahame, Ward Bond (starring); Frank Capra (director); Frances Goodrich, Albert Hackett, Jo Swerling (screenwriters)

Show Details

Description:

N.p.: RKO Radio Pictures, 1946. Vintage oversize double weight reference photograph from the classic 1946 film, showing actors James Stewart and Donna Reed. Stamp specific to RKO's French release on the verso, along with annotations in manuscript pencil. Based on Philip Van Doren Stern's 1943 short story, "The Greatest Gift," about a man at the end of… Read more about this item

Item Price

US$450.00

More Photos

Girlfriends (Collection of 14 original photographs from the 1978 film)

by Claudia Weill (director, screenwriter); Melanie Mayron, Christopher Guest, Eli Wallach, Bob Balaban, Kristoffer Tabori, Viveca Lindfors (starring)

Show Details

Description:

Burbank, CA: Warner Brothers, 1978. Collection of 14 vintage photographs from the 1978 film, including five borderless reference photographs and nine studio still photographs. A young, single photographer struggles to maintain her friendship with her former roommate after the woman marries and moves out of their longtime shared apartment. Weill's first feature film, a warm and incisive… Read more about this item

Item Price

US$350.00

Carmen Jones (Original photograph from the 1954 film)

by Dorothy Dandridge (starring); Otto Preminger (director); Georges Bizet (music); Oscar Hammerstein II (book); Harry Belafonte, Pearl Bailey (starring); Harry Kleiner (screenwriter)

Show Details

Description:

N.p.: N.p., 1954. Vintage reference photograph from the 1954 film, showing actors Dorothy Dandridge and Harry Belafonte talking with Robert Mitchum and director Otto Preminger. Loosely based on the 1943 musical, an all-Black stage adaptation of Bizet's 1875 opera "Carmen," which was in turn based on Henri Meilhac and Ludovic Halevy's 1845 novella. A parachute factory worker… Read more about this item

Item Price

US$175.00

Lawrence of Arabia (Original photograph taken on the set of the 1962 film)

by David Lean (director); T.E. Lawrence (book); Robert Bolt, Michael Wilson (screenwriters); Alec Guinness, Anthony Quinn, Peter O'Toole, Jack Hawkins, Jose Ferrer, Anthony Quale, Omar Sharif, Claude Rains (starring)

Show Details

Description:

N.p.: N.p., 1962. Vintage reference photograph of actor Anthony Quinn and producer Sam Spiegel shaking hands on the set of the 1962 film. Based on T.E. Lawrence's 1926 autobiography "Seven Pillars of Wisdom." Opening in 1935 with the death of Lawrence (Peter O' Toole) in a motorcycle accident at the age of 46, we follow, in flashback,… Read more about this item

Item Price

US$125.00

More Photos

The Heiress (Original photograph from the 1949 film)

by William Wyler (director); Ruth Goetz, Augustus Goetz (play, screenwriters); Olivia de Havilland, Montgomery Clift, Ralph Richardson (starring)

Show Details

Description:

Los Angeles: Paramount Pictures, 1949. Vintage studio still photograph from the 1949 film. Based on Ruth and Augustus Goetz's 1947 play, which was in turn based on Henry James' 1880 novel "Washington Square." A shy young woman falls in love with a poor but handsome man, to the displeasure of her father, who believes the man only… Read more about this item

Item Price

US$25.00

More Photos

Rebel Without a Cause (Original color-tinted photograph from the 1955 film)

by James Dean (starring); Nicholas Ray (director); Robert Lindner (book); Stewart Stern, Irving Shulman (screenwriters); Natalie Wood, Dennis Hopper, Sal Mineo (starring)

Show Details

Description:

Burbank, CA: Warner Brothers, 1955. Vintage hand-tinted color studio still photograph from the 1955 film. With censorship stamp on the verso. Nicholas Ray's searing study of juvenile delinquency, generational divide, and moral decay in suburban America, loosely based on Robert Lindner's 1944 book "Rebel Without a Cause: The Hypnoanalysis of a Criminal Psychopath." Released less than a… Read more about this item

Item Price

US$350.00

A Streetcar Named Desire (Original photograph from the 1951 film)

by Tennessee Williams (playwright); Elia Kazan (director); Marlon Brando, Vivien Leigh, Kim Hunter (starring)

Show Details

Description:

Burbank, CA: Warner Brothers, 1951. Vintage studio still photograph from the 1951 film. Based on the 1947 play by Tennessee Williams, who collaborated with screenwriter Oscar Saul and director Elia Kazan on the screenplay. Kazan, who also directed the Broadway stage production, cast all the actors from that production with the exception of Jessica Tandy. Nominated for… Read more about this item

Item Price

US$125.00

More Photos

Gone with the Wind (Three original photographs from the 1939 film)

by Clark Gable, Vivian Leigh (starring); Victor Fleming (director); Margaret Mitchell (screenwriter, novel); Hattie McDaniel, Barbara O'Neil, Evelyn Keyes, Ann Rutherford (starring)

Show Details

Description:

Beverly Hills, CA: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer [MGM], 1939. Three vintage reference photographs from the 1939 film. One photograph with a stamp on the verso identifying the film and actors Clark Gable and Hattie McDaniel. The legendary adaptation of Margaret Mitchell's 1936 novel, about the headstrong daughter of an affluent confederate plantation owner whose family is brought low during the… Read more about this item

Item Price

US$75.00

More Photos

Kiss Me Deadly (Collection of five original photographs from the 1955 film noir)

by Robert Aldrich (director); A.I. Bezzerides (screenwriter); Mickey Spillane (novel); Ralph Meeker, Albert Dekker, Paul Stewart, Strother Martin, Jack Elam, Cloris Leachman (starring)

Show Details

Description:

N.p.: N.p., 1955. Collection of five vintage reference photographs from the 1955 film. Two with provenance labels affixed to the versos. Perhaps the ultimate film noir in the classic cycle, and by far the best (and most insanely interpreted) Spillane adaptation. Director Robert Aldrich spins the hard boiled source material into a symphony of speed, violence, and… Read more about this item

Item Price

US$450.00

Blazing Saddles (Original photograph of Cleavon Little and Mel Brooks on the set of the 1974 film)

by Mel Brooks (director, screenwriter, starring); Cleavon Little, Gene Wilder (starring); Norman Steinberg, Andrew Bergman, Richard Pryor, Alan Uger (screenwriters); Slim Pickens, Harvey Korman, Madeline Kahn (starring)

Show Details

Description:

N.p.: N.p., 1974. Vintage reference photograph of Cleavon Little talking with director Mel Brooks on the set of the 1974 film. Brooks' slapstick homage to the Western, in which an escaped African American railroad construction worker becomes the sheriff in an all-white town, and must protect it from politicians and railroad tycoons looking to raze it. A satire… Read more about this item

Item Price

US$250.00

North By Northwest (Original photograph of Alfred Hitchcock and Cary Grant on the set of the 1959 film)

by Alfred Hitchcock (director); Cary Grant, Eva Marie Saint, James Mason (starring); Ernest Lehman (screenwriter)

Show Details

Description:

Beverly Hills, CA: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer [MGM], 1959. Vintage studio still photograph of director Alfred Hitchcock talking with actor Cary Grant on the set of the 1959 film. An innocent man is pursued across the US by a group of foreign spies, who have mistaken him for a government agent. Widely considered one of Hitchcock's best films, the last… Read more about this item

Item Price

US$450.00

Gaslight (Original photograph from the 1944 film)

by Ingrid Bergman, Charles Boyer, Joseph Cotten, Angela Lansbury (starring); George Cukor (director); Patrick Hamilton (play); Walter Reisch, John Van Druten (screenwriters)

Show Details

Description:

N.p.: N.p., 1944. Vintage reference photograph from the set of the 1944 film noir, showing actors Ingrid Bergman and Charles Boyer entering Bergman's aunt's long-vacant London townhouse. Based on Patrick Hamilton's 1938 play, and a remake of the 1940 British film starring Anton Walbrook and Diana Wynard. Nominated for seven Academy Awards, winning two, including Best Actress for… Read more about this item

Item Price

US$250.00

Girlfriends (Original photograph of Claudia Weill and Melanie Mayron on the set of the 1978 film)

by Claudia Weill (director, screenwriter); Melanie Mayron, Christopher Guest, Eli Wallach, Bob Balaban, Kristoffer Tabori, Viveca Lindfors (starring)

Show Details

Description:

N.p.: N.p., 1978. Vintage borderless reference photograph from the 1978 film, showing director Claudia Weill with actress Melanie Mayron on the set. Annotations in manuscript ink on the verso. From the archive of film historian and author Joel Finler. A young, single photographer struggles to maintain her friendship with her former roommate after the woman marries and… Read more about this item

Item Price

US$325.00

Rebel Without a Cause (Original photograph of James Dean, Sal Mineo, and Natalie Wood from the 1955 film)

by James Dean (starring); Nicholas Ray (director); Robert Lindner (book); Stewart Stern, Irving Shulman (screenwriters); Natalie Wood, Dennis Hopper, Sal Mineo (starring)

Show Details

Description:

N.p.: N.p., 1955. Vintage reference photograph from the 1955 film, showing James Dean, Natalie Wood, and Sal Mineo walking down a stairway together, with a suit of armor in the foreground. Nicholas Ray's searing study of juvenile delinquency, generational divide, and moral decay in suburban America, loosely based on Robert Lindner's 1944 book "Rebel Without a Cause: The… Read more about this item

Item Price

US$450.00
